cinch noun
(FOR HORSE)
[ C ] US a strap that goes around the middle of a horse to keep the saddle (= rider's seat) in the right position on the horse's back: The Diné weavers made a variety of items, including saddle blankets and cinches.

cinch verb
(TIGHTEN)
to fasten a belt, strap, or piece of cloth tightly, especially at the waist of a piece of clothing so that it fits closely to the body: This skirt would look lovely cinched at the waist with a wide belt. He cinched his towel around his waist. The jeans are cinched in at the waist.
